documents.document:
WHAT IS LOVE,

Love is a four letter word, but whose counting? It means the same no matter what language you use It is what makes the world go round, or so they say. Love brings a smile to the face of many, tears to the eyes of many more. It is invisible to some, yet so easy to see. It can bridge and ocean, yet be hard to find Love makes people blind, yet fills ones eyes with beauty Love is something we should all be thankfull for. Long Live Love! Love is all things amazing It is sources of emotion That pin prick our realities Transforming our spirits minds souls It is as great as it is small As hidden as it seen Broad in its context yet defined individually Love is the unique expression that evolves Us from being beasts of burden to a celestial humanity Angelic existence which bestows us all gifts of the heart Beyond all things love can be singular, plural and universal And sometimes nothing at all. Yet Overall Love is something That is everything Touched given and received To all human Beings At least once or twice Along our journey Through this err of predictability That our Mortal life. Love.....you can’t touch it..... But you can give it.... You can’t hold it..but you can understand it You can’t smell it, or taste it...but you want it Love...so sweet...so comforting... So desired....so beautiful....a gift from God.... Love, a part of you.... shared..a part of you.. given Love, the kiss from an angel....the hug of passion The hope for tomorrow…..the beauty of today Love made for you and I, a feeling of warmth A feeling of being needed, wanted and cared for Love, a reason to go on living...a reason for trying Love, the reason...we are here...to see the beauty... In a man and a woman…..in love Love...an obtainable ecstasy One which each living soul strives to achieve Two souls combine as one Sharing emotions, dreams, and desires Love is an entity The grandeur of prayers Love is in the eyes of a child Embracing each new day as a miracle Our hearts crave the intensity Souls feed off the necessity Love creates a bond Unbreakable through time Fulfilling passions of the wildest imagination Reaching out to another in trust The fulfillment in the softest of touch Love is given…Love is received… The most amazing power to enrich… or deceive Love is that which comes from deep within once released it blossoms as a fragile flower nurtured then the bloom endures but neglected it does go to seed left unpollenated it turns to dust becoming nothing more than soil undisturbed .

I GIVE IT TO LADIES ON PAN ANYBODY THAT SAYS HE OR SHE WRITE IT SHOULD COME AND CONFRONT ME,I AM A WRITER AND STILL HAVE MORE IN STOCK

AN HONOURABLE WOMAN

You, Sweet Love, are an honorable woman
When all is said and done, you are.
And I, well I suppose I am almost
as honorable as you…..almost.
If we weren’t, you would be on
the next plane here and I would do
nothing to dissuade you from
coming to me, staying with me,
loving me in the complete expression
of what we both secretly know we feel.

But….you can’t because you are
honorable and I would want you to be
no other way, for it is part of the man
I admire and respect so much, honor.
Even if it should be misplaced and
completely unappreciated, it is noble
and priceless in my eyes… the true you.
The you that will deny and hurt herself
rather than those who depend on her.
And I could not come to you…no, not
with these chains or thoughts of any other,
nor could I cause selfish pain to other hearts.

So here we are… drowning every day
in the sea of our damned honor;
longing to look into each others’ eyes
aching to touch…. just once, even if
it had to stop at a brief platonic hug.
I’ll send you my thoughts, my warmth.
You’ll bask in them and feel alive again.
You will ache to hold, to protect me
to shelter me from fear and heartaches;
while we honorably love each other
from a very great distance in miles
but with no aloofness in our hearts.

LAWRENCE,KNIGHT TEMPLAR AND A BLACK POET

POTRAIT OF A WOMAN

To all Special Ladies not all Women or Ladies

She gave him a portrait of a woman
world of pleasure and pain in her eyes
Her heart unspoiled and tender
no need to wear a disguise

Each day he glanced at the portrait
but the person he could never see
Ignoring the passion and pain in her eyes
and the woman she could be

Days spent together becoming weeks
and weeks soon evolving to years
The pleasure and pain in the portrait’s eyes
were veiled now by woman tears

She gave him a portrait of a woman
but the portrait was all he would ever own
The love and life deep within her eyes
were shrouded and finally gone

She gave him a portrait of a woman
too distant for his longing tangible touch
Each day he gazed at that portrait
desiring her beauty so much

He saw beneath the chilled apathy
discovering beyond the numbed disguise
a world of pleasure and pain
revolving within her eyes

Thawing her chill with warm love words
caressing her silent soul with piercing truth
Until the world in her eyes opened to him
and her love became the proof

She gave him a portrait of a woman
too distant for his yearning tactile embrace
but he found a whole world to possess
in the beauty of the portrait’s face

Lawrence,Vikings

DISTANCE(SCARED TO MEET YOUR LOVED ONES IN ANOTHER COUNTRY?)

The distance was so great, a long road
covered by jagged rocks of pain and despair.
My journey was long, My Sweet Love
until I found this home, this shelter in your arms.
Your words reached into the core of my soul
capturing, enclosing me in your love and devotion.
Bathing away the grime of dark desolation
in the shimmering, rushing waterfall of your ardor.
Burning to ash hopelessness and apathy
in the white-hot fire of your disturbing passion
You won not my affection alone, but my admiration.
How could I not love a man such as you?
Never did I dare to entertain a hope of touching you.
The only recourse, the well of my heart poetry
poured out to you with wild abandonment to
the longings and satisfactions your love awakened
We adored from a distance, in heart and word
Never, My Love, did I dare to imagine I would be
wrapped in your arms, revel in your touch
taste the sweetness and raw need of your lips.
Never would I feel your hardness deep within
nor give you the hot, rhythmic pleasure
of my secret softness surrounding, embracing you

WE WILL STILL MEET IF YOU BELIEVE.

Lawrence,Royal Vikings

~THE DARKEST HOUR IS JUST BEFORE DAWN~

Dark harrowing hours
Kneeling before the sun
Stooped knees bent
Heart pleading
Reaching for release
In the silence…
I see your face,
Through every tear
A barren place
You left a silhouette
To keep me near
Now I’m
Breaking shaking
Seeking sanctimony
Where is time? to
Knit away the darkness
When pleading hearts
Cry cashmere dew
So dark is this hour
Before the dawn

You walked away
leaving me alone/you
left me without a smile
won't you look back, once more
before you leave my life
once more in silent reflection
hear my pleading heart
close your eyes and try
the ragged emotions on the edge
ready to plunge into the abyss
that is a living hell,
won't you remember
in love's stormy darkness
It is always darkest
before the dawn
Storyheart Sleepless nights, tossing,
turning the beds clothes
into a storm raged sea.
Waking, eyes blank, bloodshot,
looking but not seeing.
Deep scars, still open
covering my heart.
Oozing the last drops
of our love.
Darkness coveres
the light of my soul.
Like a candle snuffed out,
so my life ended
the day you left.
Perhaps tomorrow
I can face the world again.
Perhaps one day my
aching heart will heal.
A small spark will light
the darkness of my soul.
To show it is darkest
before lifes new dawn

When life's new dawn
appears my aching heart
will soar faraway
from the lonely darkness
to a brand new tomorrow.
Filled with precious memories
of yesterday leaving behind
the darkest hour just before dawn

Lawrence,Royal Vikings

ART OF SERENDIPITY

The plane lurched and she was sucked quickly back into reality.

"We are beginning our final descent. The captain has asked that you please fasten your seatbelts & return your tray to an upright and locked position."

She blinked rapidly and tried to regain her bearings. All around her began the cacophony of the flight crew preparing for landing. She looked at her tray, still locked in front of her. She had never taken it down. She had been too excited and so terribly nervous. When they passed out the meals she politely declined. Even after the flight attendant reminded her the flight was 10 hours - her nerves got the best of her. So, she had closed her eyes and tried to sleep her way through this seemingly stoppage of time.

So as the world busied itself around her, she thought about the dream again. It gave her a sense of comfort. There was no regret or worry just the simple feeling of "knowing" that it was right & the direction was clear. She smiled to herself as she let the memories of the past months tumble through her mind like a bubbling brook.

They hadn't been looking for each other. Well, not specifically for each other. She supposed that they had both been looking for something, but what it was - she really didn't know. All she did know was that from the first time they spoke, there was something special about him. She couldn't pinpoint it exactly. There was so much about him that was amazing. The more they spoke, the more this connection between them grew. And even though they were thousands of miles apart, it seemed at times that they had known each other all their lives. Many times they had agreed they were separated by circumstance, but connected by something much more profound. Comfortable, was a word they often used when talking about how they felt with each other.

They shared things with each other that they didn't tell anyone else. When something or someone upset one, they both cried. When one received good news, they both celebrated. They shared everything from the highest highs to the lowest lows, but it was the little things, the everyday occurrences, that they both loved to share with each other the most. It connected them together in a way that few shared. Their hearts became one - beating in perfect rhythm.

And when, after months of exploration, she realized that she had fallen in love with him - there was no explosion of light or bells sounding in the distance. But better yet, a calm that surrounded her, a sense of knowing that this is why she had been brought to this place in her life - to be with him.

She smiled to herself as she recalled the twinkle in the laugh she had heard so many times on the telephone. It reached the deepest places inside her and lit them up brighter than any sun possibly could. Even now, when nothing more than a vivid memory, it made her quietly laugh to herself and she felt herself lighter just from the remembrance.

Her friends had thought she was crazy. Most of them had turned her back on her when she informed them of her decision to fly halfway across the world to spend time with him. But there were a few, those whose hearts belonged to others far away, that understood why she had to do this. But none of them could ever understand how deep their connection ran. It was beyond the realm of words, beyond any description she could offer. It was the first time in her life she could feel her soul.

So now, here she was - almost ten hours into a flight that had the power to break her heart or promise new beginnings. It was terrifying and exhilarating all at once and from the way the butterflies were bouncing inside her - she had no doubt that she was experiencing it all to the fullest extent. They had made no promises to each other, no expectations of forever - but inside she knew, this trip teetered on a new horizon for both of them.

After what seemed days instead of minutes, the plane finally set down on the runway. As they taxied in, she peered through the window at the foreign countryside around her. Fields of green dotted by cattle & sheep mixed in with the urban hustle and bustle of the nearby city. She took it all in quietly, but even now, it felt like she'd been here before.

As the plane came to a stop, she unbuckled her seatbelt, but her feet wouldn't move. Her heart was pounding so hard in her ears. She was afraid if she stood, she might fall right back down in a dead faint. Questions tumbled through her mind, "What if he doesn't like the way I look? What if we're suddenly shy around each other? What if this was the wrong thing to do?" Round and round on the carousel of doubt she found herself twirling and before she even realized it, she was up and out of the plane and making her way through customs.

A long and tedious line, customs proved more nerve racking than the flight itself. Little by little the passengers moved through the long lines and one by one they disappeared through the gray doors at the end of the hallway. She knew he was out there - waiting. The thought made her close her eyes and take a deep breath to keep from falling. Finally, it was her turn. Yes, she was here on holiday. No, she had nothing to declare. "Except unconditional love," she thought to herself and found the corners of her mouth turning upwards at the thought. With one swoop of his hand, the customs agent stamped her passport and motioned her through. The doors loomed ahead of her and she stopped for a moment, trying to comprehend what these next few steps meant.

She took a deep breath and pushed the doors open.

It was crowded in the airport. All around her private reunions were taking place. Mothers greeted daughters. Husbands kissed their wives. Hands were shaken and welcomes professed. The fluorescent lights overhead hummed with a life of their own as she shyly looked through the teeming crowds for any sign of the face that she saw each time she closed her eyes. She scanned the terminal but didn't spot anyone familiar. She felt the panic begin to rise up within her and she fought the instinct to turn and walk to the nearest desk for a flight home. But suddenly, she saw him - he was there - across the room standing quietly in a corner. His eyes focused intently on hers. She would know those eyes anywhere. Beautiful pools of color that she could lose herself in. Even at this distance, the effect they had was dizzying.

He began to walk toward her and she felt her eyes begin to well with tears. By the time he was standing in front of her, she was trembling and biting her lip trying to keep some composure. Their eyes had never left each other's as he crossed the busy terminal toward her. It was if time had suddenly stopped and they had become the only two people in the world. She had the sensation of people walking past, conversations being held, but they were far in the background now. The only thing that mattered was the two of them.

He did not speak, only smiled. But it was a smile that spoke ten thousand words. His eyes were wet with tears. He held out his hands and offered her a bouquet of wildflowers. She recognized them as the Kinds they had laughed about growing around their cottage. The one they would build on the seashore to spend their days together. When he held them out to her, she burst into laughter and tears at the same time and gently placed her hands on his. When their skin touched, it was as if all the electricity in the world had been funneled into this one spot. It shook her down to her core.

Suddenly, he took her in his arms and spun her around, both of them laughing into each other. Their embrace grew tighter until nothing separated them. It was then that their lips found each other and they succumbed to a kiss.

A kiss that had been written about for centuries, but had never been done poetic justice. A kiss that held the promise of all tomorrows and the fates of all the yesterdays.

A kiss that told the tale of two souls that rode on the backs of angels and made their way skyward past the trail of Icarus.

For all of us whose hearts belong to someone far away.

Lawrence Oladipupo Olamilekansi Akinloye Olarerin
Royal Vikings

LAWDIP21 AND TODAY IS 21ST MEANING YOU(U) ME THE CODE BIT RIGHT NOW THE SULTAN LAWDIP673,673===BRUNEI,SULTAN OF BRUNEI,THE RICHEST MAN FOR SO MANY YEARS DEALS IN GOLD BUT RIGHT NOW THE BLACK DIAMOND FOR MY PEEPS BUT TO MY ENEMIES ALWAYS EAT STONESSSSSSSSSSS

"TINTERN ABBEY"

FIVE years have past; five summers, with the length
Of five long winters! and again I hear
These waters, rolling from their mountain-springs
With a soft inland murmur.Once again
Do I behold these steep and lofty cliffs,
That on a wild secluded scene impress
Thoughts of more deep seclusion; and connect
The landscape with the quiet of the sky.
The day is come when I again repose
Here, under this dark sycamore, and view
These plots of cottage-ground, these orchard-tufts,
Which at this season, with their unripe fruits,
Are clad in one green hue, and lose themselves
'Mid groves and copses. Once again I see
These hedge-rows, hardly hedge-rows, little lines
Of sportive wood run wild: these pastoral farms,
Green to the very door; and wreaths of smoke
Sent up, in silence, from among the trees!
With some uncertain notice, as might seem
Of vagrant dwellers in the house less woods,
Or of some Hermit's cave, where by his fire
The Hermit sits alone.

These beauteous forms,
Through a long absence, have not been to me
As is a landscape to a blind man's eye:
But oft, in lonely rooms, and 'mid the din
Of towns and cities, I have owed to them
In hours of weariness, sensations sweet,
Felt in the blood, and felt along the heart;
And passing even into my purer mind,
With tranquil restoration: -- feelings too
Of unremembered pleasure: such, perhaps,
As have no slight or trivial influence
On that best portion of a good man's life,
His little, nameless, unremembered, acts
Of kindness and of love. Nor less, I trust,
To them I may have owed another gift,
Of aspect more sublime; that blessed mood,
In which the burthen of the mystery,
In which the heavy and the weary weight
Of all this unintelligible world,
Is lightened: -- that serene and blessed mood,
In which the affections gently lead us on, --
Until, the breath of this corporeal frame
And even the motion of our human blood
Almost suspended, we are laid asleep
In body, and become a living soul:
While with an eye made quiet by the power
Of harmony, and the deep power of joy,
We see into the life of things.

If this
Be but a vain belief, yet, oh! how oft --
In darkness and amid the many shapes
Of joyless daylight; when the fretful stir
Unprofitable, and the fever of the world,
Have hung upon the beatings of my heart --
How oft, in spirit, have I turned to thee,
O sylvan Wye! thou wanderer thro' the woods,
How often has my spirit turned to thee!
And now, with gleams of half-extinguished thought,
With many recognitions dim and faint,
And somewhat of a sad perplexity,
The picture of the mind revives again:
While here I stand, not only with the sense
Of present pleasure, but with pleasing thoughts
That in this moment there is life and food
For future years. And so I dare to hope,
Though changed, no doubt, from what I was when first
I came among these hills; when like a roe
I bounded o'er the mountains, by the sides
Of the deep rivers, and the lonely streams,
Wherever nature led: more like a man
Flying from something that he dreads, than one
Who sought the thing he loved. For nature then
(The coarser pleasures of my boyish days,
And their glad animal movements all gone by)
To me was all in all. -- I cannot paint
What then I was. The sounding cataract
Haunted me like a passion: the tall rock,
The mountain, and the deep and gloomy wood,
Their colours and their forms, were then to me
An appetite; a feeling and a love,
That had no need of a remoter charm,
By thought supplied, nor any interest
Unborrowed from the eye. -- That time is past,
And all its aching joys are now no more,
And all its dizzy raptures. Not for this
Faint I, nor mourn nor murmur, other gifts
Have followed; for such loss, I would believe,
Abundant recompense. For I have learned
To look on nature, not as in the hour
Of thoughtless youth; but hearing oftentimes
The still, sad music of humanity,
Nor harsh nor grating, though of ample power
To chasten and subdue. And I have felt
A presence that disturbs me with the joy
Of elevated thoughts; a sense sublime
Of something far more deeply inter fused,
Whose dwelling is the light of setting suns,
And the round ocean and the living air,
And the blue sky, and in the mind of man;
A motion and a spirit, that impels
All thinking things, all objects of all thought,
And rolls through all things. Therefore am I still
A lover of the meadows and the woods,
And mountains; and of all that we behold
From this green earth; of all the mighty world
Of eye, and ear,both what they half create,
And what perceive; well pleased to recognize
In nature and the language of the sense,
The anchor of my purest thoughts, the nurse,
The guide, the guardian of my heart, and soul
Of all my moral being.

Nor perchance,
If I were not thus taught, should I the more
Suffer my genial spirits to decay:
For thou art with me here upon the banks
Of this fair river; thou my dearest Friend,
My dear, dear Friend; and in thy voice I catch
The language of my former heart, and read
My former pleasures in the shooting lights
Of thy wild eyes. Oh! yet a little while
May I behold in thee what I was once,
My dear, dear Sister! and this prayer I make,
Knowing that Nature never did betray
The heart that loved her; 'tis her privilege,
Through all the years of this our life, to lead
From joy to joy: for she can so inform
The mind that is within us, so impress
With quietness and beauty, and so feed
With lofty thoughts, that neither evil tongues,
Rash judgments, nor the sneers of selfish men,
Nor greetings where no kindness is, nor all
The dreary intercourse of daily life,
Shall e'er prevail against us, or disturb
Our cheerful faith, that all which we behold
Is full of blessings. Therefore let the moon
Shine on thee in thy solitary walk;
And let the misty mountain-winds be free
To blow against thee: and, in after years,
When these wild ecstasies shall be matured
Into a sober pleasure; when thy mind
Shall be a mansion for all lovely forms,
Thy memory be as a dwelling-place
For all sweet sounds and harmonies; oh! then,
If solitude, or fear, or pain, or grief,
Should be thy portion, with what healing thoughts
Of tender joy wilt thou remember me,
And these my exhortations! Nor, perchance --
If I should be where I no more can hear
Thy voice, nor catch from thy wild eyes these gleams
Of past existence -- wilt thou then forget
That on the banks of this delightful stream
We stood together; and that I, so long
A worshiper of Nature, hither came
Unwearied in that service: rather say
With warmer love -- oh! with far deeper zeal
Of holier love. Nor wilt thou then forget,
That after many wanderings, many years
Of absence, these steep woods and lofty cliffs,
And this green pastoral landscape, were to me
More dear, both for themselves and for thy sake!

Law

CATHARSIS

LAW

Is this how the story goes?
Does the tale have a happy end?
I'm losing all sense and hope,
Fighting a battle in which I can't contend...

I close my eyes and run away
To a forbidden and forsaken land,
Where only in fantasies,
With you, can I take a stand...

No need to fight,
No need to run...
Our fairy tale has just begun.

Enchanted dreams
Become realities,
When we're together - two in one.

I come into your world,
Through a door locked, without a key...
I look into your eyes...
We both know what I see.

A vision of us - hand in hand -
In a future not quite far...
Two hearts beating in coalition,
Their love carried on the same bright star.

No need to fight,
No need to run...
Our fairy tale has just begun.

Enchanted dreams
Become realities,
When we're together - two in one.

When will we be with one another?
So we can devote all our love to each other.

OLADIPUPO LAWRENCE VIKINGS POTRAIT

TIL I WAS AWAKEN BY NIGHT

Loudly from the quiet
within a dream inside a dream
you came to me
so sweetly and serene.

From out of mind shadows
carefully I stepped toward you
glowing with hope
that my dream had come true.

In rising before you
hesitantly I took your hand
yet right you felt
like spring sun warming winter land.

Quickly I discovered
nearly all of my adult life
I'd been sleeping
'til awakened by you that night.

Lawrence,VIKINGS
